newsitem.title: INDIA: At least 38 killed in India explosives warehouse.
newsitem.headline: At least 38 killed in India explosives warehouse.

text.p: At least 38 people were killed in a blast in an explosives warehouse in India's western state of Maharashtra on Thursday, the United News of India (UNI) said.
The Press Trust of India (PTI) had earlier said the blast occurred in a construction warehouse near the town of Satara, killing 19 and injuring 23 people.
PTI quoted a district official in Satara as being unsure of the cause of the blast.
UNI said its reporter found rescue operations in progress at the building which had collapsed with the impact.

UNI, in a separate report on Thursday, quoted police in the state capital Bombay as saying they had arrested a man alleged to be planning to kill Bal Thackeray, leader of Maharashtra's rightwing Hindu Shiv Sena party, with a bomb.
It said the Moslem man, identified by police as Abdulla Salafi, was planning to target Shiv Sena's offices on Wednesday, the anniversary of a string of bomb blasts in Bombay on March 12, 1993.
Some 260 people were killed in the attacks that were linked to underworld Moslem gangs, apparently seeking revenge for the demolition of a 16th century mosque by Hindu militants in December 1992.
